column4: for some reason my laptop screen won't go idle/sleep even though I have it set to go to sleep after 2 minutes. anyone got any suggestions?
do you have an optical mouse?
yes
it may be sending spurious movement signals. Try unplugging it. If that works, plug it back in, but turn it on its back.
thanks ill try that
that still doesn't turn the display off
do you use the inhibit applet?
whats that?
it's a gnome applet that you can use to disable screensaving -- e.g. when you're watching a movie. I thought you might have set it to inhibit-mode inadvertently
any way for me to check that? i.e. a config file
not really -- you would probably know if you had it on your panel
is it possible that folding@home or pidgin is preventing it from going to idle?
I'd say that's unlikely
ive tried killing both of those apps and unplugging the mouse to no avail.
and you haven't got a second pointing device, like a trackpad or tablet?
only the touchpad on my laptop
ah
try installing gsynaptics and disabling the trackpad. You have to make a modification to /etc/X11/xorg.conf for it to work
I mean touchpad
alright
alright i installed gsynaptics and now im in the xorg.conf file, what should i edit
any idea what lines to edit on xorg.conf?
add this line to the InputDevice section that pertains to your touchpad: Option "SHMConfig" "true"
you will have to restart X
